results.question: What is the difference between the <script> and <link> elements in HTML?

options.answer: <script> is used to link external files, while <link> is used to embed scripts directly in the HTML page.
<link> is used to link external files, while <script> is used to embed scripts directly in the HTML page.
<script> and <link> are interchangeable and can be used for both linking external files and embedding scripts.
None of the above.

results.question: What is the purpose of the "defer" attribute on the <script> element in HTML?

options.answer: It specifies that the script should be executed immediately after the element has been parsed.
It specifies that the script should be executed as soon as possible, without blocking the page.
It specifies that the script should be executed after the document has been parsed.
It specifies that the script should be executed asynchronously.

results.question: What is the role of the "viewport" meta tag in HTML?

options.answer: It defines the maximum width of the page on mobile devices.
It defines the minimum width of the page on mobile devices.
It defines the size of the viewport in relation to the device screen.
It defines the background color of the viewport.

results.question: How can you make a form input field required in HTML?

options.answer: Set the "required" attribute to "true".
Set the "mandatory" attribute to "true".

Set the "validate" attribute to "mandatory"

results.question: What is the role of the "scoped" attribute on the <style> element in HTML?

options.answer: It applies the style to the current element and its children only.
It applies the style to the current element only.
It applies the style to the entire document.
It prevents the style from being applied to the current element.

results.question: How can you make an image responsive in HTML?

options.answer: Set the "max-width" property to "100%".
Set the "width" property to "100%".
Set the "min-width" property to "100%".
Set the "height" property to "100%".

results.question: What is the difference between the "id" and "class" attributes in HTML?

options.answer: "id" is used to specify a unique identifier for an element, while "class" is used to specify a group of elements.
"id" is used to specify a group of elements, while "class" is used to specify a unique identifier for an element.
"id" and "class" are interchangeable and can be used for both unique and group identifiers.
None of the above

results.question: What is the role of the "picture" element in HTML?

options.answer: It allows you to specify multiple images for different device sizes and resolutions.
It allows you to embed videos in an HTML page.
It allows you to define a range of values for an input field.
It allows you to create a scrolling text marquee.

results.question: What is the role of the "figure" element in HTML?

options.answer: It is used to mark up a list of items.
It is used to represent a section of a document.
It is used to mark up a quotation.
It is used to group together a caption and the media it is describing.

results.question: What is the difference between the "margin" and "padding" properties in CSS?

options.answer: "Margin" sets the space between an element and its border, while "padding" sets the space between an element's content and its border.
"Margin" sets the space between an element's content and its border, while "padding" sets the space between an element and its border.
"Margin" and "padding" are interchangeable and can be used for both content and element spacing.
None of the above.
